intro: Anerincleistus beccarii, commonly known as the Beccari's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. Its sap is milky and can be toxic, a common feature among members of the spurge family. Anerincleistus beccarii often grows in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in dry or semi-arid conditions.
